alert.note: Alert for Charles City; City of Williamsburg; James City; New Kent; Prince George; Surry; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 22 at 2:53PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Virginia, south central Virginia and southeast Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, in east central Virginia, Charles City and New Kent. In south central Virginia, Prince George. In southeast Virginia, City of Williamsburg, James City, Surry and York. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 251 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain in the advisory area. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen since this morning. - Additional rainfall amounts around 0.5 inches are expected over the area during the next hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Newport News, Williamsburg, Charles City, Claremont, Surry, Toano, Norge, College Of William And Mary, Queens Lake, Roxbury, Rustic, Holdcroft, Jamestown, Scotland, Ruthville, Cabin Point, Kings Point, Burrowsville, Adkins Store and York Terrace. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; City of Williamsburg; James City; New Kent; Prince George; Surry; York
